name: Marissa Umphrey
text: I have have lived here for almost four years. Its quiet for the most part and very cheap rent. It's easy to get to Pelham, Chelsea, Alabaster, or well anywhere you need to go. The hospital is only 15-20 minutes away. Also several churches and three school districts to choose from. Aside from the train and traffic it's quiet at night. Really nice and peaceful place as long as you stay away from the neighbors. Have seen people come and go and heard my fair share of drama here. So if you are quiet and work it's great, just don't come thinking people are friendly, their not. Otherwise water, garbage, and lawn care are included in the rent so it's even more affordable. The maintenance guy is on site so if you have a problem it's handled quick. The land lord is a sweet but sassy elder lady who knows the business well. She is great to talk to and very understanding, she really makes living here great. Wooddale is wonderful.

name: Baby Justice
text: Extremely reasonable rates, quiet, laid-back, close knit community, friendly residents that are always willing to give their neighbor a hand when needed. Sweetest, most caring and understanding landlord you could ever hope to have. You couldn't find a better place for the price, in this day and time, with this nice of an atmosphere, out there anywhere else .

text: This is not a place to raise kids. Been here for a year and there has been nothing but drama and filth spread around. There is trash surrounding the lake and the park manager will tell everyone your business. Some of the neighbors like to watch your home and look in windows.

resp.text: Having taken over ownership/management of the neglected park this month (July 2021), we are so excited about making your community a home you can be proud of, and a safe and fun area for children.   We hope to add a playground area.  Please feel free to reach out to us.  - CSP

name: Juliana McMullin
text: I was a former tenant, plus I have friends who still live there. The mobiles available for rent are shoddy and falling apart. The whole park has a roach infestation, the sewers are not connected correctly. The septic tanks tend to overflow, and a friend of mine who lives there still says her toilet and sink water run straight-out underneath the mobile home onto the ground. They go through a lot Park managers, a good portion of them either stealing rent or being on drugs. The park itself is beautiful, the grass is kept mowed and there's a lovely pond with fish in it. It needs better mobile homes, and better management.

resp.text: Having just taken over this greatly neglected beautiful site this month, we are ecstatic about making the park shine.  We are on both city water and sewer, and have no septic tanks. While there are some older sewer lines we are upgrading, I can assure you there are currently no leaks of any gray water or the like anywhere on our property. Our new manager Michael is a church-going, hard-working family man with a wealth of experience in the industry.  Check us out in 12 months. We are also looking for a local landscaper to assist with new plantings.  - CSP

name: Charlie Herron
text: Trailers dilapidated and in various stages of collapse. I nearly froze to death in the winter. Rent is cheap but that's relative when you get a 400 dollar power bill.

resp.text:
Mr. Herron, All of our homes have fully functional ELECTRIC central heat. And the unit in your home was quite new. If you had issues during residency reports should have been made. Were any reports made to the office of ANY needed repairs? Upon report of needed repairs our full time maintenance person(s) take care of our homes. Upon leaving our community we found the unreported needs in the home where you resided,  they were addressed and we have had 2 very happy residents in that home in the time since you left including currently.

In our lease we ask for needed repairs to be reported timely. We prefer to take care of issues as they arise and never allow them to accumulate or become unkempt housing conditions. Believe me it costs us less to fix things as they become an issue and there is a great expense upon turnover to  bring one back from resident neglect. Had maintenance needs been reported both parties would have had a better experience during tenancy as well as had a better taste in each of our mouths at the end of residency.

I hope you have found happiness in your housing, since. Best wishes to you Mr. Herron.

name: Salisa Love
text: No dogs allowed the ones worth having

resp.text:
We have a variety of homes including, those at well below market price to serve 1 st time renters and those just starting out. Most of our residents choose to upgrade to larger and more expensive homes as they have established a rental history and as their lives allow them to allocate more to rent. The smaller, older homes, as  are all of our homes are maintained by a full time maintenance person(s) and we fix things when they are reported and it is a reasonable request. There is a market in our community for homes under $500 and I am proud to say we offer the best around in that price point.

Have you ever taken a tour with me or applied to live in our community?

Yes we are indeed no dogs, since 2009. However we have a large number of residents who have lived here for 10+, 20+ and 30+ years. So you will see some residents with pets.

I appreciate the opportunity to clarify. Thank you for leaving a review.

text: Our experience living here has been a nightmare. For starters we ended up with 2 landladies and signed 2 different leases. One for the mobile home, and one for the lot. Within 3 months of living there one of our landladies asked our 19 year old son for sperm to make a baby, literally 4 minutes after declining to donate to them through text message, she texts me and says Sharon in the office needed me purchase $50 per month pet insurance through the trailer park and pay her husband an insane amount of money for mowing grass in the yard that doesn't exist. The yard is a mud pit. I found out they are good friends so I've obtained a lawyer. Sharon is disrespectful, degrades her tenants by talking down to them as if she's better than them and always has an attitude. I'm almost 40 and have been renting since I was old enough and never have I ever been so disrespected and treated with such hatefulness. Repairs were never made. We have a hole rotted on the bottom of the door my German shepherd can stick his head through so we've had to block off that door and use the back door unfortunately. It's a mess. text: The entrance (road system) here is ATROCIOUS!! Be warned of some obviously neglected asphalt. Good Luck you can even restore the walls or ceiling to a basic white. People drive in and out like they stole cars all hours of the night and your told to keep music down to minimum but apparently some have special treatment because it's boombing all the time and all hours of the night. VERY FEW (3 bedroom /2 Bathroom) places available and they charge you only $100-120 extra a month for extra room & bath. Um what. Driveways are a nightmare, you or a guest will likely get stuck in your pen drive due to the mud. And there is a GREEN pond where I'm told all the run off and backwash from the water systems hooked to all the trailers go, I've even heard that sewage runs off there. name: Pastor Lestley
text: My family and I have lived here for over 20 years. This place has been through 3 different owners.The first set of owners, who pioneered the existence of this trailer park, were the Odom family, and they brought our community together by having an open door,  a laundry mat/storm shelter, and holiday parties each year. They treated us like family and made us feel welcomed. Thank you to the Odom family and their staff: Mrs. Brown, Jessie, Reginald, and Miss Mary Anne. The 2nd set of owners lived out of state and closed down the office. They started coming to open the office just a few days out of the month, but we had already lost that sense of family community and were not able to get to know them like the first owners. We started becoming concerned about the park because of neglect. And, before we knew it, they sold and we were under new management. Bridget is the new community manager, and she makes us feel welcomed too. I am so thankful that the new owners have started investing into this park and have built a new picnic pavilion and playground for the kids. They have plans to tear down the old tennis court and build a basketball court. I know that when you place a little money to focus on the kids then it will draw families and make our park a great success. This is a family-friendly park and a place where we try to get to know our neighbors. It makes us proud to call this place home.

name: Mary Beth Carter
text: The mobile home my daughter rented from Aug 17 through Sep 22 at lot 46 smelled like mold & mildew & management put air fresheners everywhere to cover it up. Three of the 4 kitchen drawers were covered in green, fuzzy mold both inside & out. The carpets were not steam cleaned & left us with black bottomed socks. The cupboards were not clean. Ants swarmed inside the home & inside our vehicles several times. We found mud tunnels under the kitchen sink as if the ants had incorporated the place in to their massive ant hill colony. There's roaches of all sizes, some as big as you'd see in a zoo & they fly. We could hear dripping between the roof & the ceiling even when it wasn't raining & rain poured inside the living room window when it was raining. The dryer drum didn't turn so they replaced it with another dryer. The one they brought was so filthy on the inside that it took 2-3 hours to scrub it clean before it could be used. Previous repairs were not done properly but instead done with crummy looking shortcuts. Management had told us that 2 places were available & that this one needed the least amount of work. The fact that any of this was acceptable to rent to anyone indicates that management desperately needs to be replaced with management that has a much higher level of standards. I have several pics I'd like to share as well but I don't see an option here that will allow me to do so.

text: This place is pathetic, I lived there for a couple years and during the last couple of months my dishwasher quit working so they had "maintenance" bring out another one that looked like it had sat in a barn for a while either way it worked so I didn't complain until I started seeing roaches in my place so I called and they had someone come out, I thought it was an exterminator but it wasnt, they sent out one of their on people to "investigate" the source and a week later I received a letter stating that the roaches had not come from the dishwasher and they were not responsible for the cost of an exterminator. Needless to say I moved immediately, I gathered all of my stuff and put it in a uhaul and fogged it 5 times to make sure there were no roaches in my stuff. A year after I left I received a letter in the mail from lee county court stating I was being sued over due rent from when I left. First off I'm not paying for a place YOU are supposed to keep pest free, secondly I was there 2 more weeks, at most I would owe was 1/2 month rent which would've been $300 and my $600 deposit should've covered that so the way I see it you owe me $300. Either way these worthless people slapped a $1200 judgment on my credit. No worries, what goes around comes around

name: TIM
text:
Giving it a one star since I can't give GPS zero stars and leave a review. Managers don't care about the residents, they cut the water off without warning most of the time. I understand that repairs are necessary. They destroy property and never come back to fix it when working on repairs.
The workers are too lazy to actually check the water and electricity usage of each resident, so they just take a wild guess and charge us for that amount, most of the time being way more. Our monthly bills are never delivered on time and they get mad at us for not paying the specific amount, and if they do deliver it they just throw it on the porch, SOMETIMES they'll tape it to our door. But if they do it'll be a few days late.
The repairs call for breaking the road, and the road repairs can take up to months to be fixed. I'll be adding pictures of the roads later.

Edit: 7 months later and surprise surprise!! They haven't fixed the roads! All management has been doing is refilling it in with gravel that goes everywhere and makes the place look worse!

name: Marta Logan
text:
If your here for fishing and plan on being up early thank Pecan Grove is just fine. But we had a concerning arrival. We did arrive late as we told the lady who took our reservation a 2 weeks prior and the website stayed open until 9 pm. We arrived at 8:45 pm. She answered the phone saying she didn’t have our reservation and that we must have made it somewhere else. But a after giving her multiple details she decided to get dressed and help us find a spot.
We were here on vacation and only spent two nights actually at camp sit the r eat out on neater on boat. Both mornings to be woken up by either a hammer or lawn mower before 7 am. It would have been night to sleep in on vacation.
So if your coming to fish and leaving early it’s perfect, small place and close to water.

resp.text: We sincerely apologize for the headache all of this caused you during your stay. I agree being woken up early on your vacation is not fun. I am thankful you brought this to our attention and have adjusted our labor working hours to better suit our vacationers. As far as the problem you ran into upon arrival we are currently making changes to management operations so we hope to have resolved anything from happening in the future. We hope to see you again in the future.

name: CJ Kay
text: We actually stayed here for a few months a while back. It would be a MUCH nicer place if the guy that runs it wasn't a complete jackass ! Other than that, the neighbors are friendly & it's very peaceful most of time. Oh, if he asks you to pay cash.. MAKE sure he doesn't pocket the money. He has pulled that with a few people the few months we stayed.

resp.text: We apologize you had anything less than pleasant experience while staying with us. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and are currently making changes to our management operations. We are in the process of getting the "Square" system as another option of payment for our tenants and vacationers. We hope you come back and see us.

name: Kris Jensen
text: This is a small RV park with many trees. The staff are friendly and the Wifi is good. Place is a bit rundown. No bathrooms, and the laundry is sub par: one washer and dryer in a shack. The road noise is quite bad. We stayed two nights in a 35 foot fifth wheel.

name: Ron Turner
text: Terrible experience, the owners of this park have entrusted two of their residents to manage the campgrounds. I had a poorly worded threatening note duct taped to my door by “management” during my stay. The less tenants, the happier these folks are. By far the absolute worst experience I have ever had at a campground and I spend probably 80% of the year traveling from camp to camp.

resp.text: I am so sorry it has taken this long to see this and apologize for the terrible experience you had while staying with us. I want to ensure you that we have very recently made changes to our management operations to better make our tenants stay more pleasant. I hope you will give us another opportunity in the future to make your stay a more pleasant one.

name: Sharon Stearns
text: Ridgewood Village has been a great place for our daughter while in college.  The park management is helpful, professional, informative, kind, reasonable, and very timely in their work and responses to us.  The park is well taken care of, is close to the Auburn University campus, is a shuttle stop for the University shuttle for students, and everyone is so friendly!  The park post office boxes are always accessible and holds large packages safely so they can be picked up anytime by residents!  I would highly recommend living at Ridgewood!!

name: Nicholas McDonald

Just a theory ;)  Glad I don't live there, but it isn't a terrible place.

text:
OK let me preface this review with the fact that in the last 11 days we have been to approximately 10 RV Parks from Northern California; Oregon; Idaho; Wyoming; NM; CO; OK; TX; TN; AK; and North AL.
The  pool is fresh and alive with the sound of kids ; easy pull in; friendly propieters; needs a good deal of TLC starting with repaving the whole park; definitely no perks of frills; if you wanna get your gritty trailer park culture on -this is it-spotty internet; no clubhouse; or showers or bathrooms; no doggy area; there is random grassy area to rear side of property lines for doggies to sniff; several near demolished or abandoned manufactured homes; mostly trailers and 5th wheels at front of property; lots of military personnel; we r here to see family for two weeks; definitely not a “good sam” status but at least we got 50amps electric; sewer ,water and a place to park the 67’ of luggage in tow; its a cultural experience and for that we are grateful; as well as having time w family; kids and my brother deploying soon— bless Enterprise RV for providing safe basecamp and shelter a mile from our  family and their cozy abode.

name: Karen Lehman
text:
We have stayed here a few times now while visiting my mom who lives just 10 minutes away. Very friendly community, hookups work and the sites are clean and maintained as far as keeping up with the mowing and weeds.  My husbands only complaint is some of the sites are not easy to get all the level, so improvements to the spots would be super beneficial.
In the summer the pool is open. It’s clean, a nice suave and the long term community uses it and seem to behave and respectful of noise and closing time for travelers.   The staff is so nice, friendly and accommodating. They are super helpful getting up into your site and making sure you are allowed set.
NOTE: They only take cash, check or PayPal, no credit cards so be prepared for that.

name: Amber Shepherd
text:
We were helping a family member move into a new rent-to-own trailer in the park. When we got there, one of the managers came over and told us that the money that was given was just to hold the trailer so no one else could rent it. There was a still an amount of money that I'm not sure of for rent. Well, our family member doesn't get paid until the first and if the manager hadn't been so helpful, they wouldnt have had a place to live. The manager okayed them paying the rest of the rent on the first.

Then, we were trying to turn the water main on so we could have, well, running water. When we turned the knob, water shot out because the main pipe had a huge crack in it. One of the workers was in a  bedroom fixing something and as soon as he was told about the crack, he stopped what he was doing to check on it. Within 15 minutes there were 4 or 5 more workers helping with the pipes and fixing the stuff inside that they hadn't gotten too before we moved the furniture in.

All in all, I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a cheap place either permanently or temporarily. The prices are fairly cheap.

resp.text: Thank you Amber! We appreciate your feedback! 😊🙏

Karen is right. We had a awful noise issue with the tenant 2 doors down from her home. Our on-site security guard served him a 7 day notice for violation of park rules and he has since been served an eviction. No more noise issue 😊✅. We value quiet and peaceful enjoyment.

As for disrepair... the park is under new ownership and we are remodeling homes 1 by 1. It’s a slow process and we have high demand when a home is ready and occasionally before we get a chance to work on it.

I believe at the time of Karen’s move in she was in a hurry to get into some thing right away due to her circumstances, ready or not.

The condition of that home at the time was what it was. She wanted it, approved it and moved in 🤷‍♂️.

However... We do have 7 remodeled homes ready and available today. Call 334-245-6410 x 1 to setup a showing Today 😊🙌

name: Melinda Looney (Zombieminna)
text:
One mile from I-22 (Corridor X) so you can be just about anywhere in the greater Birmingham area in less than 15-20  minutes, makes for an easy commute. The park has been cleaned up and is still going through renovations at this time. There are some bad spots on the middle road, but the county has filled the potholes coming into the main entrance into the park.
It is safe and very family friendly.  Everyone tries to look out for one another, so in a way we have our own neighborhood watch program. We are in unincorporated Jefferson County  and Jefferson County Sheriffs Department will respond if there happens to be s problem. Forestdale is the responding Paramedic/Fire Department and have been very helpful in several emergency situations that have come up in the past few years.
There are quite a few new families moving in with children of all ages, so this is a very family friendly environment. We are zoned for Gardendale High School (EXCELLENT SCHOOL SYSTEM) and Brookville Elementary Schools.  If you happen to be looking for Christian or Private schooling, Sumiton Christian School starts enrollment in Kindergarten and goes all the way through high school and is about 15-20 minutes away and  there is also Forestdale Baptist School that also begins enrolling in kindergarten and goes to the sixth grade and is about 7- 10 minutes away.
Overall, this is a diverse community of friendly people.
I suggest stopping by the office around the first of each month or calling the park manager to schedule a time to walk through and get a feel for the community.  I describe it as living in the country with all of the city's conveniences.

What was most dissatisfying, considering it was $35.00 a night, was that there was no bathhouse or laundry and no WiFi or cable, because the cable was broken at our site.  The site was level and we had no problem in length for our 30 ft. motorhome, car dolly, and car.  We only stayed for one night, so it was doable, but I won’t want to stay longer.

Thank you for your constructive feedback of our park. We are sorry that you did not have a excellent experience with our park. name: The Adventures of Sparky Madness
text: I've lived half a block away for seven years.  I fell in love with that particular block of Montgomery Alabama.  Everything in my life changed, I got divorced December 7th, fired from my job of 6 1/2 years exactly one week later.  I'd initially wanted to buy a mobile home and they didn't have a lot for one that long.  When I bought my camper and was informed I couldn't stay where I had taken it, I called again, just in case.  That's my hood!  I love I got to choose and they were willing to accomodate me!  I have no intention of leaving any time soon and it's just so good to come "Home", I've never had one of those before!   There are no words to describe how nice my neighbors are, how I have things precious to me sitting in my yard and no one has come along to bother them.  I am getting to live where I want to live and it's affordable!  Camper living is a whole other market.  I have a lovely yard, I can fence, my neighbors are awesome and one of my very favorite people at the job I work lives on the same street and she rides to work with me every day!  What a blessing!  Never mind bad reviews!  No one ever erected a statue for a critic.  I love where I am and I'm at Sunshine Village!!!!!!  I'm also a local artist, painter, in fact, have a huge collection I'd love to sell.  I decided to be a farmer, so I'm growing food, I teach English, paint classes, throw birthday and sip parties, I give rides, pick up orders and install and teach others about gardens.  All of these doors of opportunities opened up to me, because I wanted to live and moved to Sunshine Village!

text: I would give this company no stars if possible due to the out of this world exceedingly terrible customer service and communication. For all we know come a month from now they will yet again come up with a reason to delay us further. They are a bunch of crooks that will make you feel like you are making the right choice but then use every excuse or mean ms available to make you want to not want to stay there. I don’t know how they got 4 stars unless it’s through fake reviews

name: Wendy Hernandez
text: If you plan on living here, be prepared for your base rent amount to be "adjusted" at least once a year to a higher amount, on very short notice. The management is terrible as they can't seem to keep a manager on site. During the five years I lived there, they hired and fired several managers. You can be cited, and threatened like I was if you are lucky, for the most insignificant things, also things not included in your rental agreement if they are not to the managers liking. I was threatened to be evicted if I didn't repaint the trim on my home because it looked "wet" they said. This home had been sitting there for years with the same paint, nobody said anything until I moved in. A friend of mine was threatened to be evicted if she didn't remove a box from her yard that management claimed was a dog house. It was a box her son used for parkour but management did not accept that as a valid response. You are only allowed two parking spots. Don't you dare park anywhere else because the minute you do someone will tell on you. It doesn't matter if its parking spaces in front of an empty lot, you will get in trouble. Also, you can expect there to be favorites as in any community. You will notice that in the lease agreement that trampolines and swingsets and small pools are not allowed, yet you will notice your neighbor has one they don't get in trouble but if you happen to have that item in your own yard, you will receive a written warning. There is an inground pool here but don't expect it to be clean and don't expect the pool monitor (if they even show up or have one on duty) to actually monitor anything at all. The last year I lived here the pool monitor brought her "special cup" and drank the whole time she was on duty. Other years there was only a monitor present for a few hours a day. If your neighbors are loud or unruly you might as well call the police because management won't do anything about it. Especially since there isn't any several months out of the year. At the time I sold my home there were at least 8 other residents who did the same because of the increases in rent and the poor management. During the years I lived there, at least once every two months there was a road block set up at the entrance. I am not exaggerating by any means, there were times that it was a few weeks apart instead of months apart. There's only one way in and out of the park, so the residents were constantly being subjected to being harassed by police just to get into the park and to their residence. All in all, this place was terrible to be as strict and overpriced as it is. If you're looking for a mobile home community, stay far away from this one.

name: Destiny Powell
text: I was interested in woodward estates Once I saw there Approval wasn’t based off of a certain credit score, im a young college student so I was looking for something affordable and spacious. I was told that I had been denied the first time I applied but I immediately received a call back stating I had been approved with a $780 deposit I was thrilled to know I had finally had a place to call home I came into the office paid my $780 deposit on 08/08/2020 Amanda never told me how much more I would have to finish paying since I thought I’d be moving in 08/22/2020 I thought it would be prorated 1st months rent . I called several times to find out the remainder and I was given the run around eventually I was told that the “marketing manager” didn’t base my approval on a $780 deposit which I had already paid but instead they wanted me to pay $1,085 plus 2 months rent $1,560 for a trailer . I immediately told Amanda I couldn’t afford to pay that amount what had changed from what she told us ? If I knew that we would have never paid the $780 initially. I was told by Amanda to come into the office fill out a form and we would reviver our deposit back I filled out a form 08/13/2020 since then it is now 09/09/2020 and I have still not received my money back from the property ! I have to call everyday I have still been giving not enough answers on when I should get my money back . It saddens me to think the world could be so cruel when it comes down to money . We didn’t hesitate to pay our deposit so we’re unsure of why it’s been over a month and we haven’t received it yet. I planned to use that money for my next place before I’m homeless and the property doesn’t seem to care about giving people money back at an appropriate time especially when I’m not even living at there property
